ACT
124
Ability to inherit
An heir can only be a person who is alive at the time of the opening of the inheritance.
A child already conceived at the time of the opening of the inheritance will be considered to have been born if it is born alive.
Legal persons are also capable of inheriting on the basis of a will, as well as acquiring rights to records and being a beneficiary of testamentary dispositions, unless otherwise specified by a special law.
If two or more persons lost their lives in the same event, it shall be considered that neither of them was alive at the time of the opening of the inheritance of the other, unless the contrary is proven.
